snippet: New and long overdue incentives are needed to reward good teachers while easing chronic low performers out of the system.
abstract: Editorial applauds Education Secretary Arne Duncan for pushing long overdue effort by the states to create rigorous teacher evaluation systems that reward good teachers and help ease chronic low performers out of the system; highlights a study done by Brooklyn-based policy group the New Teacher Project, which demonstrates how ineffective current systems are.
lead_paragraph: New and long overdue incentives are needed to reward good teachers while easing chronic low performers out of the system.
